title: NASA Awards Launch Services Contract for Sentinel-6B Mission
summary: NASA has selected Space Exploration Technologies (SpaceX) of Hawthorne, California, to provide launch services for the Sentinel-6B mission.

title: Arianespace to launch first operational Vega-C with two Earth observation satellites
summary: Arianespace is preparing for Vega-Consolidation’s (Vega-C) first operational launch, which is set to carry the Pléiades Neo 5 and 6 Earth-observation satellites to a Sun-synchronous orbit (SSO). Vega-C is targeting liftoff from the Ensemble de Lancement Vega (ELV) pad at the Guiana Space Centre on Dec. 20 at 10:47 PM local time (01:47 UTC on Dec. 21).

title: After a long struggle with Martian dust, NASA’s InSight probe has gone quiet
summary: InSight landed on Mars in 2018 with the aim of studying seismic activity.

title: Fiscal year 2023 omnibus bill provides $25.4 billion for NASA
summary: A fiscal year 2023 omnibus spending bill will provide NASA with nearly $25.4 billion, an increase of more than 5% from 2022 but less than what the agency requested.

title: SpaceX’s Starlink satellite internet surpasses one million active users
summary: SpaceX says its Starlink satellite internet service has surpassed one million active subscribers just two years after its first limited beta release....

title: Ukraine will get 10,000+ more Starlink antennas
summary: Ukraine will receive over 10,000 Starlink antennas to help counter Russian air attacks, said Mykhailo Fedorov, deputy prime minister and minister for...

title: NeuralAgent and Miratlas jointly address atmospheric impediments to optical communications
summary: German startup NeuralAgent GmbH is joining forces with French startup Miratlas SAS to address a vexing problem for satellite optical communications: transmitting data through Earth’s atmosphere.

title: SpaceX preparing to start Starlink Gen2 launches this month
summary: SpaceX could start launching second-generation Starlink satellites in the coming weeks to add more capacity to its increasingly congested broadband network.

title: NASA to Air Live Coverage of US Spacewalk for Solar Array Installation
summary: NASA astronauts aboard the International Space Station will conduct a spacewalk on Wednesday, Dec. 21, to install a rollout solar array to increase electrical power in support of operations and scientific research.

title: Russians assess flight worthiness of damaged Soyuz docked at space station
summary: Russian managers are assessing whether a damaged Soyuz spacecraft docked at the International Space Station can safely carry its three-man crew back to Earth in late March as planned or whether a replacement must be launched to take its place, officials said Monday.
